Official statistics from the Ohio Depart: Family Services suggested that approximately 11.8 percent of Amazon's 6,000 Ohio workers might receive food stamp benefits.
The 11: 8 percent figure was based on estimates and only represented the situation in one single state, Ohio. It was also highlighted that income is not the sole factor determining food stamp eligibility.
The claim was supported by a report from: which estimated that around 700 Amazon workers in Ohio (more than 10 percent of the company's employees in the state) receive Supplementary Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits.
PolicyMatters Ohio provided corroboratin: The data showed that as of August, 1,430 Amazon employees or their family members were receiving SNAP benefits in Ohio.
